name: Check list Description: RSS Walls-Fill Placement
ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcing elements shall be placed on top of the compacted fill material and connected to the wall panels.
• Any twists, kinks, sags or deviations in the reinforcing elements shall be removed prior to the placement of fill material on the reinforcing.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Correct number of reinforcing element shall be attached to each panel
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Grid Strips are to be installed at the back of each panel in correct length and to the correct anchors at the back of each panel
– Bolts are to be snug tight.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Plan positions of Grid Strips are to be as IFC Drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Plan positions of Grid Strips are to be as IFC Drawings.
– Grid Strips are not to pass over pile cap. RSS used in conjunction with a bridge abutment shall be independent of the bridge structure.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The vertical deviation of the soil reinforcement shall be within +1% upwards and -0.3% downwards of the soil reinforcement length, relative to the connection height.
• Avoid clash with drainage as directed in IFC Drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Fill layers to be spread and compacted in layers not exceeding a compacted thickness of 200mm
• All RSS fill layers to be spread from the back face of panel to tail of soil reinforcing straps
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Moisture content of the backfill shall be maintained evenly at all times.
• Moisture content shall be within 0% to -2% of the optimum moisture content. Any backfill material exceeding the optimum moisture content, must be allowed to dry
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Select backfill shall be placed in accordance with Vicroads section 204 and compacted to 98% of standard proctor density.
• Compaction within 1 meter of the wall face shall be achieved by a light weight (Hand Operated) mechanical tamper roller or vibratory system.
• No large compaction equipment shall be allowed in this zone.
• Compaction beyond 1 meter of the wall face shall be in accordance with the table VR 204.111

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: After three consecutive lots of like material have achieved the specified requirement, the contractor may seek the superintendent's agreement to reduce the frequency of testing of subsequent lots to the minimum requirement specified in table 204.142:
Three Consecutive Lots tested to satisfy this requirement.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Referenced Lots in This Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Testing frequency shall be in accordance with Vicroad Specification section 204.14
• The Contractor shall submit compaction test results for each layer of fill placement to the Superintendent for review and acceptance.
• No further fill placement shall be allowed if the total thickness of fill placement is greater than 1 m measured from the last layer that has been accepted.
• If any layer is found to be not in compliance with the compaction requirement, that layer and the layers above it shall be removed
FREQUENCY: Each Fill Layer or every second layer as agreed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All layers of fill shall be test rolled in accordance with VR 173. The contractor Shall provide for the superintendent to be present during all test rolling
Document Title: CHK-005-STR-CAMMS-RSS Walls-Precast Panel installation
Check list Description: RSS Walls - Panel installation
ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Plan position shown on the drawings at the base of the wall shall not exceed ±15mm (refer to drawings for WP locations)
2 - Mark - up panel for construction team
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Mark number of strips per row on the back of each panel.
– Mark design locatoin (Wall number, row and column) as per elevation drawings on the back of each panel
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: RSS Panels are to be installed as per IFC Drawings and specified schedule.
– Check the 19mm nominal gap to be maintained
– Check the 1 in 40 slope is to be maintained
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 20mm nominal gap between panels and Abutment wall is to be mainatined
– 300mm wide x 6mm thk Galvanized plates fixed to abutment wall and Adjacent panel as per IFC drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Install Filter Fabric against all vertical and horizontal joints
FREQUENCY: Each course of panel installation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Install 150mm wide vertical strip drain "PRODRAIN PD20"-at every vertical joint between panels in RSS wall.
• Ensure no gap is formed between strip drain and RSS panels
FREQUENCY: Each course of panel installation

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: To ensure compliance with the tolerances specified in clause 682.20, the Contractor shall install stable and permanent survey reference points on a not more than 5 m (horizontal) by 2 m (vertical) grid covering the whole face of the RSS
FREQUENCY: Each course of panel installation
8 - Traceability of precast units and records
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Unique ID of precast panel is recorded.
ATTACH: marked-up elevation drawings or installation record with reference to panel ID
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Attached marked-up drawing or installation record

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The level and alignment of each course of facing panels shall be checked progressively after placement of each course and prior to placement of the next course to ensure compliance with the dimensional and positional tolerances stated in the design.
The Contractor shall record the results of this checking together with details of any non-conformances and the associated corrective actions
– Relative displacement of adjoining smooth panel faces shall not exceed ±15mm measured normal to face of the wall
– Local deviation of the wall face at any location with a 3m straight edge, shall not exceed 15mm
– Variation in gap width between facing panels shall not exceed 5mm per meter length and 10mm over the full lenght of the gap
– The wall level shall not deviate from the specified level by more than ±20mm
– The tolerance of position measured at the top of the wall face shall not excedd 5mm per 1m of wall height
– The verticality of the RSS wall facing shall lean backward at a minimum slope of 1(H) in 40 (V)
FREQUENCY: Each course of panel installation
ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: CONCRETE COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH GRADE MUST NOT BE LESS THAN N25 FOR LEVELLING COURSE AND BACKING BLOCKS;
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Select fill shall comply with the requirements of the RSS designer:
• The select backfill must meet the minimum requirements of Vicroads Type A filling
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill behind the reinforced block shall be Vicroads Type B or better and:
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Perforated plastic pipe perforations shall be a maximum width of 1.5mm and minimum length of 150mm per m2
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast supplier is required to provide the following Quality Assurance documentation for each element, typically this consists of:
i. Certificate of Compliance / Birth Certificate
– 5.Confirmation of number, type and capacity of lifting inserts;
Collate: Precast Quality Assurance Documentation so it can be uploaded into Teambinder pre-cast supply Lot (don't attach it here)
Reference: Precast panels MDR Lot in TeamBinder:
FREQUENCY: Once for each type of panels
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Precast panels Birth certificates and MDR Lot

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The foundation material beneath the RSS fill shall be inspected on site by a qualified geotechnical Engineerto ensure that the soil conditions meet the assumed material properties:
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP, Test results
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where the foundation material does not meet the assumed material parameters, the existing ground shall be replaced with VR Type A fill Compacted in accordance with VR 204
– Ground improvement works shall be keyed into surrounding material at minimum 200mm Bench width
– Ground improvement works shall extend beyond either side of bridge approach to detail show in IFC drawing
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Areas upon which fills are to be constructed shall be test rolled in accordance with VR 173
• No Fill shall be placed against or within 3 meters of a structure until the foundation for the fill has been reviewed by the superintendant

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey activities to be undertaken to ensure and validate that all Works meet level and location requirements within the tolerances as per the tables in IFC Drawings and Vicroads Specification
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Form timber shutters to edge of levelling pad
– Levelling pad is a 500mm wide by 150mm thick unreinforced concrete footing
– The leveling course level shall NOT deviate from the specified level by  mor than ±3mm.
– 20mm Nominal gap between levelling pad and adjacent ground beam is to be maintained
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete to be placed in accordance with 610.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete testing for compressive strength shall be undertaken at the testing frequency specified in VicRoads Section 610.16 (b)
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Attach Concrete Test Report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Levelling course level shall not deviate from the specified level by more than ±3mm
– Plan position shown on the drawings at the base of the wall shall not exceed ±15mm (refer to drawings for WP locations)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The level and alignment of each course of facing panels shall be checked progressively after placement of each course and prior to placement of the next course to ensure compliance with the dimensional and positional tolerances stated in the design.
• The Contractor shall record the results of this checking together with details of any non-conformances and the associated corrective actions
• Refer to checklist for each course of panels
FREQUENCY: Each course of facing panel
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Inspection record checklist: CHK-CIV-RSS Pre-cast panel installation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: To install 300mmx300mmGranular backfill in Geotextile BIDIM A64 around 100mm Dia. Perforted plastic pipewith 0.5%min fall to 50mm Dia weepholesin RSS panels.
– Perforated pipe to have 0.5% mnimum fall to 50mm weepholes in RSS panels
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall submit compaction test results for each layer of fill placement to the Superintendent for review and acceptance.
• No further fill placement shall be allowed if the total thickness of fill placement is greater than 1 m measured from the last layer that has been accepted.
• If any layer is found to be not in compliance with the compaction requirement, that layer and the layers above it shall be removed.
• Refer to checklist for each fill layer
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Inspection record checklist: CHK-CIV-RSS Fill installation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provide record of dimensional measurements to demonstrate that all Works meet level and location requirements within the tolerances

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall take measurements of the position of the RSS at the points defined in clause 682.20(a) to (f) at intervals not exceeding one month for the first six months immediately following completion of the RSS and at intervals not exceeding six months thereafter until the end of the Defects Liability Period.
(a) plan position shown on the drawings, at base of wall shall not exceed ⌖15 mm;
(b) relative displacement of adjoining smooth panel faces shall not exceed 15 mm measured normal to face of wall;
(c) local deviation of the wall face measured at any location with a 3 m straight edge shall not exceed 15 mm;
(d) the tolerance on position measured at the top of the wall face shall not exceed 5 mm per 1 metre of wall height;
(e) the wall level shall not deviate from the specified level by more than 20 mm;
(f) variation in gap width between facing panels shall not exceed 5 mm per metre length and 10 mm over the full length of the gap.
The measurements shall be recorded in writing and reported to the Superintendent within two weeks of the survey.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
